grammary.title: Reported speach
SO / SUCH
grammary.content:
Używamy SO lub SUCH aby zwrócić na coś szczególną uwagę:
Everyone was SO friendly. They were SUCH friendly people.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
SO używamy z:
- przymiotnikami i przysłówkami:
Our journey was SO QUICK. Our journey went SO QUICKLY.
- much/little + (niepoliczalne rzeczowniki):
We had SO MUCH TIME. She had SO LITTLE MONEY left.
- many/few + (mnogie policzalne rzeczowniki):
SO MANY PEOPLE applied for that job. There were SO FEW JOBS available
===================================================================
SUCH używamy z
- a + adj. + pojedyńczy rzeczownik
We saw SUCH A GOOD FILM.
- adj. + mnogie policzalne rzeczowniki / niepoliczalne rzeczowniki
Everyone was wearing SUCH BRIGHT CLOTHES. We had SUCH DREADFUL WEATHER on our holiday.
- a lot (of ...) + mnogie policzalne rzeczowniki / niepoliczalne rzeczowniki
We had SUCH A LOT OF THING to do. He won SUCH A LOT OF MONEY.
